Pre-Game Insights: Austria and Norway, the top two in League B Group 3, face off Sunday evening in a crucial UEFA Nations League encounter.
Norway have been flying high but will face a real challenge against an Austrian side that is finding form at just the right moment.
Austria, currently second, will be looking to capitalise on home advantage and leapfrog group leaders Norway, who remain unbeaten in the competition.
Norway have been far from watertight at the back when playing on the road. They have conceded three goals in three of their last six away matches.
Haaland remains a constant goal threat. With an incredible record of 0.94 goals per game for his country, it’s hard to imagine Norway leaving the pitch without a goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Austria’s high-energy approach combined with Norway’s fragility away from home should see the hosts win, but with someone like Haaland on the pitch, it’s never safe to bet against Norway finding the net.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Norway have conceded three goals in three of their last six away matches, highlighting their vulnerability on the road.
